items.sentence: I\'ve lived in Boston a little over three years.
I\'m too old to start learning how to snowboard.
Tom flipped open his cell phone and made a call.
Tom folded the towels and put them on the shelf.
I\'m not afraid to tell Tom about what happened.
I\'m not looking forward to Christmas this year.
Tom said you speak French better than Mary does.
Tom told Mary that he was going to be home late.
Don\'t lose your temper no matter what Tom says.
Don\'t worry about things that may never happen.
Don\'t worry. Things always work out in the end.
It\'s very unlikely that Tom survived the crash.
Tom watched the squirrel jump from tree to tree.
I hear that Tom can speak French quite fluently.
I heard that Tom and Mary have both passed away.
Do you still think that I should go talk to Tom?
Tom received an urgent message to call his wife.
Tom usually eats a bowl of cereal for breakfast.
Tom walked into the bedroom to get some clothes.
Tom kissed Mary goodbye and then got on the bus.
